page.title: 03PLACE NAMES, ST. ALLEN AREA.
page.content: {St.Allen & River Allen}after an early local Celtic saint who established a place of worship,with a Celtic Cross. {Lanner Barton}Cornish "Lan" indicates historic monastic link:present owners father bought property from Church Commissioners in 1953;Barton=farmstead originally manor farm,still has owner_ ship of both sides of boundary hedge + 3ft.of neighbouring land for repairs. {Bishops Wood}originally planted by Bp. Walter Bronescombe of Exeter,13thCent. {Tremeneth}Cornish,hill_house,recently named by former owners surnamed Hill. {Ventontrissick}Cornish,brambly or bushy spring,(tributary of R.Allen.) {Nancarrow}Cornish,valley of the stag: house is at head of a wooded valley. {Marazanvose}Cornish,market at ditch. {Killivose}Cornish,grove at a ditch. {Burnett's}named after one_time owners. ACCURACY OF DERIVATIONS OFTEN DOUBTFUL
